To the chief Musician upon Neginah, <FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer.
From the end of the earth will I cry unto thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock <FI>that<Fi> is higher than I.
For thou hast been a shelter for me, <FI>and<Fi> a strong tower from the enemy.
I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.<RF>trust: or, make my refuge<Rf><CM>
For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given <FI>me<Fi> the heritage of those that fear thy name.
Thou wilt prolong the king's life: <FI>and<Fi> his years as many generations.<RF>Thou…: Heb. Thou shalt add days to the days of the king<Rf><RF>as…: Heb. as generation and generation<Rf>
He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, <FI>which<Fi> may preserve him.
So will I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.<CM>
